channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI warns that its new ChatGPT Agent has the ability to aid dangerous bioweapon development
item.description: The tool is designed to automate everyday tasks, but safety researchers found the model could also potentially help novices create biological threats

item.title: Airport security is poised to finally move on from post-9/11 era but ‘the devil is going to be in the details’
item.description: Before the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks, travelers often didn't need to show their ID at checkpoints and people without boarding passes could go to the gate...

item.title: Bolsonaro, Brazil’s Former President, Ordered to Wear Ankle Monitor Before Trial
item.description: Brazil’s Supreme Court ordered Jair Bolsonaro, the former president, to stay home most hours, defying President Trump’s demands that charges against M...

item.title: Bizarre discovery of 21 children in LA home raises questions about lack of regulations for surrogacy
item.description: Surrogacy has no federal regulation, leaving it up to states, like a child welfare agency's removal of children aged mostly between 1 and 2 from an LA...

item.title: Trump’s NPR and PBS Funding Cuts Were Decades in the Making
item.description: The cuts speak to President Trump’s grip on his party but also to the sweeping changes in media.

item.title: Mexico City’s Airbnb deal has led years later to ferocious protests against ‘digital nomads’
item.description: When President Claudia Sheinbaum was the Mexico City mayor in 2022, she signed a deal with Airbnb and UNESCO to boost tourism and attract digital noma...

item.title: Colbert canceled by CBS days after his withering criticism of parent company’s Trump settlement
item.description: Colbert told his audience Thursday that he just learned “It's the end of ‘The Late Show’ on CBS. I’m not being replaced. This is all just going away.”

item.title: Alan Bergman, Half of a Prolific Lyric-Writing Team, Dies at 99
item.description: With his wife, Marilyn, he wrote the words to memorable TV theme songs and the Oscar-winning “The Way We Were” and “The Windmills of Your Mind.”

item.title: The Impact of Defunding NPR and PBS
item.description: Congress just voted to claw back $500 million in funding for public broadcasting. Benjamin Mullin, a media reporter for The New York Times, explains w...

item.title: Floods and Heavy Rain Kill Dozens in Pakistan
item.description: Relentless rain began on Wednesday, causing flooding in several cities and across vast rural stretches in the province of Punjab.

item.title: The Seeds of Democratic Revival Have Already Been Sown
item.description: The party is getting pummeled. But it can fight back.

item.title: Friday Briefing: Bloodshed in a Syrian City
Felix Baumgartner, Skydiver Who Jumped From the Edge of Space, Dies Paragliding at 56
item.description: Nicknamed “Fearless Felix,” Mr. Baumgartner jumped from the edge of space in 2012.
